page.title: 14Bradeley village near Norton
page.content: Bradeley is an old mining village, built in the valley to the west of Norton. In 1086 it was called Bradley in the Moors. There was enough farm- land for 3 ploughs,1 acre of meadow and woodland 3 miles long and 1 mile wide. 10 families lived there. By 1775 there were a number of scattered farms including Dog Croft and Shield Croft. Over 100 years ago there was a brick works.Three streets of terraced houses were built. In Unwin St.there are 109 houses,in Brammer St., named after a nurse who lived in Bradeley, 52 houses and in Hayes St., 32 houses. Eardley House, a residential home for old people,was built in 1976.There are 54 residents and 40 staff.The old people read, sing, knit and sew and are taken out on day trips. Visitors can come at any time, and doctors visit every Friday.
